title: add default password for each protocol - particularly windows and putty
author: ray-brum
body_snippet:
We have personal accounts on windows and linux that are different and changed monthly.
Currently I add the windows account as the default addount/password, but have to override the unix servers with the linux account and change the password each month

I suspect many shops have a similar setup

would it be a good idea to be able to set a default account/password for each protocol (RDP/ PUTTY / etc).

* Version used: 1.76.20
* Operating System: multiple versions of windows on a domain + l...

comments.snippet: apparently a similar request has been made already (targetted at 1.78.*). Would default password for each protocol be easier to implement? However the other suggestion would resolve my problem too
comments.author: ray-brum

comments.snippet: I would consider this a duplicate of #2304, even though this is not protocol based. The profile solution planned to be implemented by @Kvarkas should remediate this issue and might allow the extension to define a defeault user for each connection type.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: yes planed profiles implem,entation to be done, after that you will be able to set a profile of dewfault connection (you may have several) and that profile will "know" where to look for default password and for that user profile
